## getCssRuleFromSchema

Updates a given element css variables to a given styler element
ensuring its presence in the given target element (usually head).

### Parameters

*   `selector` **[string][53]** The styling rules css selector.
*   `schema` **[Array][54]** The css rules js schema.

### Examples

```javascript
getCssRuleFromSchema([['top', 1], ['right', 2]]); // --> { 'top': '1px', 'right': '2px' }
```

Returns **[string][53]** The styling rule css string.

## getElementIndex

Gets a given element position (index) in the DOM tree
(where 0 is first-child, 1 is second etc...).

### Parameters

*   `element` **[HTMLElement][55]** The given element to be checked.

### Examples

```javascript
getElementIndex(document.documentElement); // --> 0
getElementIndex(document.head); // --> 0
getElementIndex(document.body); // --> 1
```

Returns **[number][56]** The position of the given element in the DOM tree.

## getElementParentsLength

Gets the number of ancestors of a given element.

### Parameters

*   `element` **[HTMLElement][55]** The given element to be checked.

### Examples

```javascript
getElementParentsLength(document.documentElement); // --> 0
getElementParentsLength(document.head); // --> 1
getElementParentsLength(document.body); // --> 1
```

Returns **[number][56]** The number of ancestors of the given element.

## getLayoutDimensionsCssSchema

Gets the given layout dimensions object as css rules schema.

### Parameters

*   `layout` **[object][57]** The layout dimensions objects to be set in css variables.

### Examples

```javascript
getLayoutDimensionsCssSchema({ width: 10, height: 20 }); // --> [
//  ['--outer-width', 10],
//  ['--outer-height', 20]
// ]).
```

Returns **[Array][54]** The styling rule css schema.

## getLayoutDimensions

Gets a given element or browser dimensions.

### Parameters

*   `element` **[HTMLElement][55]** The given element whose dimensions need to be retrieved.
*   `scroller` **([Window][58] | [HTMLElement][55])** The given scrollable used to retrieve some
    dimensions when the given element is global (page).

### Examples

```javascript
getLayoutDimensions(document.querySelector('div')) // --> { outerHeight: 123, ... }
```

Returns **[object][57]** The given element dimensions as an object ({ top, left }).

## getScrollPositionCssSchema

Gets the given scroll position object as css rules schema.

### Parameters

*   `scroll` **[object][57]** The scroll position to be set in css variables.

### Examples

```javascript
getScrollPositionCssSchema({ top: 10, left: 20 }); // --> [
//  ['--position-top', 10],
//  ['--position-left', 20]
// ]).
```

Returns **[Array][54]** The styling rule css string.

## getScrollPosition

Gets a given element or browser scroll position.

### Parameters

*   `element` **([Window][58] | [HTMLElement][55])** The given element whose scroll
    position needs to be retrieved.

### Examples

```javascript
getScrollPosition(document.queryselector('div')); // --> { top: 123, left: 345 }
```

Returns **[object][57]** The given element scroll position as an object ({ top, left }).

## isValidPadlockElement

Gets whether the given (first) argument is a valid DOM scroll padlock element
(a div, etc...) or not.

### Parameters

*   `element` **([Window][58] | [Document][59] | [HTMLElement][55])** The given argument to be checked for its validity
    as custom scroll padlock element.
*   `window` **[Window][58]?** The environment client global object. (optional, default `globalThis`)

### Examples

```javascript
isValidPadlockElement(); // --> throws, not an HTMLElement...
isValidPadlockElement(null); // --> throws, not an HTMLElement...
isValidPadlockElement({}); // --> throws, not an HTMLElement...
isValidPadlockElement(window); // --> false
isValidPadlockElement(document); // --> false
isValidPadlockElement(document.body); // --> false
isValidPadlockElement(document.documentElement); // --> false
isValidPadlockElement(document.querySelector('div#my-scrollable-div')); // --> true
```

*   Throws **[TypeError][60]** Throws when the given (first) argument is not
    a valid DOM scroll padlock element (a div, etc...)
    nor a global element (window, body, document).

Returns **[boolean][61]** Whether the given (first) argument is a valid
custom scroll padlock element or not.

## ScrollPadlock

Creates the scroll padlock class instance on a given scrollable element.

### Parameters

*   `element` **([Window][58] | [HTMLElement][55])?** The given scrollable element
    whose scroll needs to be controlled.
*   `options` **([string][53] | [object][57])?** An options object
    or the given scrollable element whose scroll needs to be controlled.
*   `client` **[object][57]?** An object with the client environment (window). (optional, default `globalThis`)

### Examples

```javascript
void new ScrollPadlock(window, 'locked-state-css-class');
```

*   Throws **[TypeError][60]** Throws when the given (first) argument is not
    a valid DOM scroll padlock element (a div, etc...)
    nor a global element (window, body, document).
*   Throws **[Error][62]** Throws when an instance is already attached to the given dom element.

### cssSelector

Gets the currently set css selector.

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.cssSelector // --> "[data-scroll-padlock="1-1"]"
```

Returns **[string][53]** The css selector.

### scroll

Returns the current scroll position, if on a locked state it
returns the currently saved scroll position object.

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.scroll // --> { top: 123, left: 345 }
```

Returns **[object][57]** The current scroll position object or the
scroll position previously saved if on a locked state.

### scroll

Sets a new scroll position, if on a locked state it saves that
given scroll position for a future scroll restoration.

#### Parameters

*   `position` **[object][57]** The scroll position to be set or saved if on a locked state.

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.scroll = { top: 123, left: 345 }
```

### layout

Gets the layout dimensions, such as widths, heights, scrollbars etc...

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.layout // --> { outerHeight: 123, outerWidth: 345, innerWidth: 123, ... }
```

Returns **[object][57]** The layout object.

### unlisten

Detaches a supported listener.

#### Parameters

*   `type` **[string][53]** The event type (scroll, resize...).

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.unlisten('scroll'); // pauses scroll handler
padlock.unlisten('resize'); // pauses resize handler
```

Returns **[boolean][61]** Whether the event attachment or detachment has been successful or not.

### listen

Attaches a supported listener.

#### Parameters

*   `type` **[string][53]** The event type (scroll, resize...).

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.listen('scroll'); // resumes scroll handler
padlock.listen('resize'); // resumes resize handler
```

Returns **[boolean][61]** Whether the event attachment or detachment has been successful or not.

### destroy

Effectively destroy the instance, detaching event listeners, removing styles, etc...

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.destroy(); // completely removes the padlock listeners, dom modifications etc...
```

Returns **void** Nothing.

### update

Re-evaluates dimensions and such, updates css variables to the current state...

#### Examples

```javascript
const padlock = new ScrollPadlock();

padlock.update(); // programmaticaly updates the current padlock state in its environment
```

Returns **void** Nothing.

## sanitizePadlockOptions

Formats the given scroll padlock options to a valid options object.

### Parameters

*   `options` **([object][57] | [string][53])?** The options raw argument to be formatted into object.

### Examples

```javascript
sanitizePadlockOptions('foobar'); // --> { cssClassName: 'foobar' }
sanitizePadlockOptions({ b: 'c' }); // --> { cssClassName: undefined, b: 'c' }
sanitizePadlockOptions({ cssClassName: 'a', b: 'c' }); // --> { cssClassName: 'a', b: 'c' }
```

*   Throws **[TypeError][60]** Throws when a given argument is not a valid padlock options type.

Returns **[object][57]** The options object formatted.

## setUniqueCssRule

Updates a given element css variables to a given styler element
ensuring its presence in the given target element (usually head).

### Parameters

*   `styler` **[HTMLStyleElement][63]** The styler element where the css variables are written.
*   `rule` **[string][53]** The styling rule css string.

### Examples

```javascript
setUniqueCssRule(document.querySelector('style#my-styles'), '.el { color: blue; }');
```

Returns **[HTMLStyleElement][63]** The given styler element.
